translate.message: Fix coordinate drift in hyperspace jumps - Imperial tracking was exploiting precision errors in our fleet repositioning calculations
translate.author: Luke Skywalker <luke@rebellion.org>
changes: Fixed floating point precision in distance calculations
Added coordinate validation for extreme distances

translate.message: Add polar coordinate support for Death Star approach vectors - Cartesian offsets weren't sufficient for orbital mechanics
translate.author: Wedge Antilles <wedge@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented distance/direction parameter support
Added proper spherical coordinate handling

translate.message: Emergency patch: prevent translation beyond sensor range - lost 3 probe droids to coordinate overflow
translate.author: Mon Mothma <mothma@rebellion.org>
changes: Added bounds checking for translation distances
Fixed coordinate overflow in large translations

translate.message: Initial implementation for rebel fleet positioning - need to stay mobile to avoid Imperial patrols
translate.author: Princess Leia <leia@rebellion.org>
changes: Basic geometric translation functionality
Support for Feature and FeatureCollection inputs

flip-horizontal.message: Optimize reflection calculations for Star Destroyer evasion maneuvers - every microsecond counts when dodging turbolaser fire
flip-horizontal.author: Han Solo <han@rebellion.org>
changes: Improved bounding box center calculation
Fixed edge case for single-point geometries

flip-horizontal.message: Add latitude axis flipping for Death Star trench runs - original tool only worked for longitude, useless for polar approaches
flip-horizontal.author: Biggs Darklighter <biggs@rebellion.org>
changes: Added axis parameter with longitude/latitude options
Generalized flipping algorithm for both axes

flip-horizontal.message: Fix mirror point calculation - Imperial analysts figured out our fleet movements were perfectly predictable
flip-horizontal.author: Admiral Ackbar <ackbar@rebellion.org>
changes: Corrected center point calculation for multi-geometry features
Added proper coordinate transformation matrix

flip-horizontal.message: Create horizontal flip tool for confusing Imperial tracking sensors - mirror our formations to throw off their predictions
flip-horizontal.author: Jyn Erso <jyn@rebellion.org>
changes: Initial horizontal reflection implementation
Basic geometry support for Point and LineString

flip-vertical.message: Simplify vertical flip to delegate to horizontal flip - code duplication was making maintenance difficult during the siege of Hoth
flip-vertical.author: C-3PO <threepio@rebellion.org>
changes: Refactored to use flip-horizontal with latitude axis
Reduced code duplication and maintenance overhead

flip-vertical.message: Fix inverted latitude calculations - our Y-wing formations were flying upside down relative to target coordinates
flip-vertical.author: Gold Leader <gold@rebellion.org>
changes: Corrected latitude coordinate inversion logic
Added validation for proper north/south orientation

flip-vertical.message: Add vertical flip capability for Imperial formation mimicry - they expect us to mirror horizontally, not vertically
flip-vertical.author: Cassian Andor <cassian@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented vertical reflection around equatorial plane
Support for flipping Y-coordinates of geometric features

speed-series.message: Critical fix: timestamp location bug causing hyperspace miscalculations - ships were arriving days early or late
speed-series.author: R2-D2 <artoo@rebellion.org>
changes: Fixed timestamps property location in GeoJSON features
Corrected time unit conversion calculations

speed-series.message: Add smoothing option to filter out sensor noise from Imperial jamming - raw speed data was too erratic for navigation
speed-series.author: Poe Dameron <poe@resistance.org>
changes: Implemented moving average smoothing algorithm
Added configurable window size parameter

speed-series.message: Support multiple time units - rebel pilots think in different scales than Imperial standardization
speed-series.author: Hera Syndulla <hera@rebellion.org>
changes: Added seconds, minutes, hours time unit options
Proper unit conversion for speed calculations

speed-series.message: Implement speed analysis for tracking TIE fighter patrol patterns - need to predict their intercept courses
speed-series.author: Kanan Jarrus <kanan@rebellion.org>
changes: Core speed calculation from GPS tracks
Haversine distance formula for accurate measurements

speed-series.message: Initial speed series tool for rebel fleet coordination - essential for synchronized hyperspace exits
speed-series.author: Ezra Bridger <ezra@rebellion.org>
changes: Basic time series speed calculation
Support for timestamped GPS track analysis

direction-series.message: Handle edge case for stationary targets - direction calculations were failing on Imperial listening posts
direction-series.author: Sabine Wren <sabine@rebellion.org>
changes: Fixed division by zero in bearing calculations
Added handling for zero-distance coordinate pairs

direction-series.message: Add circular smoothing for bearing data - regular smoothing was causing 359° to 1° transitions to break our autopilots
direction-series.author: Wedge Antilles <wedge@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented circular mean for angular smoothing
Fixed bearing discontinuity handling at 0°/360°

direction-series.message: Correct bearing calculations for Imperial formation tracking - our intercept angles were consistently off by 180°
direction-series.author: Garven Dreis <red@rebellion.org>
changes: Fixed atan2 parameter order in bearing calculation
Corrected coordinate system orientation

direction-series.message: Create direction analysis tool for predicting Imperial patrol routes - knowing their heading patterns is crucial
direction-series.author: General Dodonna <dodonna@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented bearing calculation from coordinate sequences
Added true north bearing orientation

average-speed.message: Handle zero-time intervals gracefully - Imperial chronometer jamming was causing division by zero crashes
average-speed.author: General Rieekan <rieekan@rebellion.org>
changes: Added zero time interval detection
Return zero speed for invalid time sequences

average-speed.message: Optimize calculation for long Imperial patrol routes - processing 12-hour Star Destroyer tracks was too slow
average-speed.author: Commander Sato <sato@rebellion.org>
changes: Improved algorithm efficiency for large datasets
Added early exit for single-point tracks

average-speed.message: Fix time unit conversion bug - our interceptor speeds were calculated as impossibly fast, confused our pilots
average-speed.author: General Merrick <blue@rebellion.org>
changes: Corrected division vs multiplication in unit conversions
Added validation for reasonable speed values

average-speed.message: Add average speed calculation for Imperial fleet analysis - need baseline metrics for identifying ship classes
average-speed.author: Admiral Raddus <raddus@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented total distance over total time calculation
Support for multiple time unit outputs

speed-histogram.message: Fix dependency on speed-series tool - histogram was failing when speed calculation module wasn't loaded first
speed-histogram.author: Jyn Erso <jyn@rebellion.org>
changes: Added proper error handling for missing dependencies
Improved tool loading validation

speed-histogram.message: Add configurable bin count - default 10 bins wasn't granular enough to distinguish between different TIE fighter variants
speed-histogram.author: Nien Nunb <nien@rebellion.org>
changes: Made bin count configurable via parameters
Added validation for minimum bin requirements

speed-histogram.message: Implement speed distribution analysis for identifying Imperial ship signatures - each class has distinct speed profiles
speed-histogram.author: Captain Antilles <antilles@rebellion.org>
changes: Core histogram generation from speed data
Statistical binning with min/max/count tracking

smooth-polyline.message: Add moving average algorithm - Gaussian smoothing was over-correcting our hyperspace exit coordinates
smooth-polyline.author: Lando Calrissian <lando@rebellion.org>
changes: Implemented moving average smoothing option
Added algorithm parameter for user selection

smooth-polyline.message: Fix coordinate preservation at endpoints - smoothing was causing our ships to overshoot landing pad boundaries
smooth-polyline.author: Chewbacca <chewie@rebellion.org>
changes: Preserve original endpoint coordinates
Improved edge handling in smoothing algorithms

smooth-polyline.message: Add Gaussian smoothing for cleaning up sensor tracks - Imperial jamming creates too much noise in our navigation data
smooth-polyline.author: Admiral Holdo <holdo@resistance.org>
changes: Implemented Gaussian kernel smoothing
Configurable window size for smoothing intensity

smooth-polyline.message: Create polyline smoothing tool for cleaning hyperspace route calculations - raw astrogation data too jittery for safe jumps
smooth-polyline.author: General Cracken <cracken@rebellion.org>
changes: Basic coordinate smoothing for LineString geometries
Support for Feature and FeatureCollection inputs

export-csv.message: Add custom separator support - Imperial data formats use semicolons, need compatibility for infiltration missions
export-csv.author: Kyle Katarn <kyle@rebellion.org>
changes: Configurable field separator parameter
Proper escaping for special characters in separators

export-csv.message: Fix timestamp handling for coordinate sequences - each position needs its own timestamp for Imperial patrol analysis
export-csv.author: Jan Dodonna <jan@rebellion.org>
changes: Individual timestamp per coordinate pair
Proper handling of mismatched timestamp arrays

export-csv.message: Add property inclusion control - sometimes we need to hide rebel ship identifiers when exporting data
export-csv.author: Bail Organa <bail@alderaan.gov>
changes: Configurable property inclusion/exclusion
Clean coordinate-only export option

export-csv.message: Implement CSV export for sharing navigation data with New Republic fleet - standardized format for interoperability
export-csv.author: General Cracken <cracken@rebellion.org>
changes: Basic GeoJSON to CSV conversion
Support for Point, LineString, and Polygon geometries

export-rep.message: Fix vessel name handling with special characters - some rebel ship names have hyphens that were breaking the format
export-rep.author: Admiral Ackbar <ackbar@rebellion.org>
changes: Improved vessel name parsing and validation
Proper handling of quoted names with special characters

export-rep.message: Add support for heading, speed, depth data - Imperial naval tracking requires full kinematic information
export-rep.author: Commander Sato <sato@rebellion.org>
changes: Extended REP format with kinematic parameters
Support for per-coordinate heading/speed/depth values

export-rep.message: Implement DMS coordinate conversion - Imperial navigation uses degrees/minutes/seconds, not decimal degrees
export-rep.author: Captain Antilles <antilles@rebellion.org>
changes: Accurate DMS coordinate conversion
Proper hemisphere handling for N/S/E/W indicators

export-rep.message: Create REP format exporter for compatibility with Imperial Debrief systems - need to infiltrate their tracking networks
export-rep.author: Cassian Andor <cassian@rebellion.org>
changes: Initial REP format implementation
Basic vessel tracking with timestamps

import-rep.message: Fix quote parsing for vessel names - Imperial ship names like 'Executor Class' were being truncated
import-rep.author: General Dodonna <dodonna@rebellion.org>
changes: Simplified quote handling in vessel name parsing
Robust parsing for names with embedded spaces

import-rep.message: Add support for multiple vessel tracks - captured Imperial data files contain entire fleet movements
import-rep.author: Mon Mothma <mothma@rebellion.org>
changes: Multi-vessel track separation by name
Proper GeoJSON FeatureCollection generation

import-rep.message: Fix timestamp parsing for fractional seconds - Imperial chronometers have microsecond precision we were losing
import-rep.author: C-3PO <threepio@rebellion.org>
changes: Proper millisecond handling in timestamp parsing
UTC timezone conversion for accurate timing

import-rep.message: Implement REP format parser for analyzing captured Imperial tracking data - their Debrief files are treasure troves
import-rep.author: Princess Leia <leia@rebellion.org>
changes: Core REP format parsing with DMS coordinates
Comment line filtering and error handling

import-rep.message: Initial REP import capability for intelligence gathering - need to decode Imperial fleet movement patterns
import-rep.author: General Rieekan <rieekan@rebellion.org>
changes: Basic REP file structure recognition
Timestamp and coordinate extraction
